website_summaries.verdict: A well-made slicer w/accessory bundle. It's the best choice for quality and value.
pros: Includes instructional video, accessory kit, recipe book, storage bag, cleaning tool, and handheld slicer
cons: Larger vegetables must be sliced first to fit the unit
Only two slicing options: spaghetti and wide ribbon

customer_reviews.title: Child's toy
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought I received the wrong item. See the photo as it explains it all. Ridiculously small and the "peeler" is plastic and wobbly.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend purchasing from this vendor!
customer_reviews.text: Update: This is literally the best customer service I have ever experienced! If you are searching for a spirlizer, I hope you buy it from here. Excellent customer service goes a long way and says a lot about the company and I would highly recommend! This is a quality product, but this is my first time spiraling vegetables, and it's honestly a waste of time for me. I know a lot of people love the zoodles, so if you are one of those people, I would definitely recommend! I just think it's more work than using a grater, and for the dishes I eat, that form of the vegetable is better for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cooking gadget!
customer_reviews.text: The SpiraLife spiralizer arrived in two days. It is surprisingly small which is good since it doesn't need a lot of space. It's super easy to use! I was able to spiralize 2 zucchini in less than 2 minutes. It brings a small bottle brush to clean it up and a bag to store it. Also, you will receive a ebook with recipes! I made zucchini shrimp scampi and it was very easy and delicious! I recommend buying it! Here are some pictures I took while using it.
customer_reviews.author: VLo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product just became worse each use, I did use quite a few times, and the cutting became so dull I had to rinse the cutter part to continue trying to cut 1 piece of zucchini. Became more time consuming then anything, compared to another one I purchased to test, there was a HUGE difference! This product failed in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't seem new
customer_reviews.text: Received this product and was excited to try it but after opening what looks like a box left over from the 90's, I took out the Spiralizer and noticed the blades look rusty/dirty, and in the center there is a piece of metal hanging there just waiting to make it into my zucchini spirals..well not today Thinking I may try to clean it if not return or garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty good for the price but one thing would have made it a lot easier and grab handle to turn the top piece as it is tiring to turn it by hand. Otherwise it works well. I have to say I received a very nice note from the manufacturer who suggested I might prefer their hand crank model which I exchanged this one for. Much easier to use and this company has awesome and responsive customer service so it is a pleasure to do business with them.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqui Marlin

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Annoying vendor.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tool and I bought two. But I'm changing my review because this vendor continues to email me daily it's very bothersome and annoying. I left a review immediately after receiving the product in the vendor continue to email me. This needs to stop.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Works but Inefficient
customer_reviews.text: This works but is not easy to handle. The blades work well and cut my squash or zucchini just fine. The problem is with having to hold the thing in one hand and the cap that holds the veggie in the other, that you twist. It is hard to control and often times veggies will slip out of the thing or the spikes that are supposed to hold the veggie spin inside of it and mash it up.It takes quite a few spins before it starts to center but it's a shaky and unstable process. And if you have arthritis, tendinitis or some other bone or muscle or hand issue, this is going to kill being able to use this.
customer_reviews.author: E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Turns Veg to Mush
customer_reviews.text: This is not a great product. It turned my zucchini to a pile of mush versus ribbons or noodles. Total waste of money and plastic and zucchini. I also cut myself when reaching into a drawer to grab this thing. I think this might be a case of company buying positive reviews? Or I’m just totally inept? :)
customer_reviews.author: sell1983

customer_reviews.title: Simple and fun food tool.
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive way to spiral noodle some zucchini. You could attempt to spiral just about any fruit or veggie, but, zucchini works real well. Cut a 3 or 4 inch tube of zucchini and with your good hand put it down in the cone and twist away. When it gets short and your fingers approach the cutter blade then switch to the spiked cap to get a grip and finish up the last of the zucchini. You are left with a small cone of zucchini that is quite edible. Now your fresh noodles are ready for butter or sauce or whatever and cook em up and be healthy about it. A simple and fun tool, like life use to be like.
customer_reviews.author: Leeroy151

customer_reviews.title: I cut my finger 2 times & wasted all vegetables! DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got one for my sister in law and myself. We tried it on some carrots and zucchinis and it simply mutilated them, not to mention it was such a horror to clean, we just threw it all away. While pushing very hard to get those zucchini noodles, it slipped from the cheap plastic cap and I ended up cutting my finger in 2 of the blades and BLOOD WAS ALL OVER THE PLACE! Do yourself a favor and avoid this!! On top of being way smaller than necessary to create decent noodles, it's a HEALTH HAZARD and you might end up with your money spent and fingers cut!!! Awful!
customer_reviews.author: Michaela

customer_reviews.title: Totally Pleased !
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the small size fool you this is a great little gadget. Great for stir fry or salad making. Clean up is a breeze. Love the little brush and the vegetable peeler is perfect. Does best with medium size Zucchini.
customer_reviews.author: MamaMia

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Makes adding veggies to meals fun! The device works great for what I was looking for: a small hand-held spiralizer for semi-frequent use and to spiralize a reasonable amount of vegetables at a time (if you plan on spiralizing many vegetables very frequently, that might be a bit much for the hand-held spiralizer). After multiple uses so far, the blades are still sharp, and the "zoodles" are very noodle like. I like how the cap helps to use up all but a small triangle of the veggie so there is very little waste. Also Lifestyle Dynamics emailed recipes and tips as described, and overall they made me feel like they cared about my satisfaction with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie D

customer_reviews.title: ... reviews and I have to say I really do love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading the reviews and I have to say I really do love it!!!! It is super easy to use and clean. I have made zoodles twice in one week and they are fantastic. I watched their quick instructional video just for an overview, so simple. My friend bought the other popular brand and said she doesn't use hers much because it is so fussy. I'm glad I got this one!!
customer_reviews.author: Salwin J. Russman

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work as described. The piece that holds the veggies still is useless so I had to turn by hand, which in turn caused me to cut my finger on the open blade. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal McD

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: My new spiralizer arrived today. I had chicken, sauce, and zucchini awaiting its arrival, so I've already used it . I thoroughly enjoyed my zucchini spaghetti lunch today. Did I miss my linguini? Not so much! Super easy & fun to use, easy to clean & store. Before its arrival, the Sellers sent me a lovely email, introducing themselves, including instructional videos and an e-Book with recipes which I look forward to trying. Awesome touch, Sellers! Kudos for offering this great little tool at an affordable price. Already, I can see this 'spiralizing adventure' is going to be great fun ~ AND HEALTHY!!
customer_reviews.author: Gnome_de_plume

customer_reviews.title: Works for Smaller Veggies
customer_reviews.text: Just smaller than expected and good for smaller zucchini and cumbers. larger ones would need to be trimmed first, but can then be used. I did not find much use for the very small included brush and either hand washed or put the spiralizer into the dishwasher. UPDATE: While this product did not meet my needs that is not to say that it is not a good kitchen tool for others. The Customer Support team is one of the best I have encountered. I rate them A+ for going above and beyond to contact me and ask further out my issues. There are sadly few companies that would the distance to ensure complete customer satisfaction, but the Spiralizer team does!
customer_reviews.author: DAP

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Makes nice zoodles I wash it in the dishwasher and it's ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I started Keto. I have only used it for zucchini noodles. I use it approximately twice a week for zoodles. Pros: Cheap Makes nice zoodles I wash it in the dishwasher and it's held up well Cons: Kinda awkward to hold while spiralizing Sometimes the top doesn't hold well to the zucchini, so it just spins around without actually spiralizing the zucchini Always have some zucchini left over that can't be spiralized, usually about an inch Makes my hand cramp Bottom line: If you are looking for cheap and still want zoodles, buy it. If you are going to have a LOT of zoodles, upgrade to something else.
customer_reviews.author: AuroraBorealis

customer_reviews.title: I have really enjoyed my SpiraLife spiralizer since getting it
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed my SpiraLife spiralizer since getting it. This thing powers through a zucchini, carrots, and squash with ease. I'm able to make my family healthy meals by omitting carb heavy pastas. Zucchini noodles with marina and ricotta is a quick delicious meal I make frequently using my Spiralizer.
customer_reviews.author: FLBroker

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good little gadget for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, though a bit hard to maneuver the vegetable when speared onto the cap. I ended up needing to remove it and hold the vegetable in one hand while turning it in the body of the gadget. I cut myself, but one could argue that this was operator error. There is a nub of the vegetable left at the end, and I'm not happy with waste in general, but this did make some very beautiful spiral noodles that my finicky spouse loved with his marinara sauce! The price was right for what I got!
customer_reviews.author: dramaprof

customer_reviews.title: I love supporting this young couple in their dream and vision
customer_reviews.text: I love supporting this young couple in their dream and vision. This is a user friendly product that makes quick and easy zucchini noodles as a substitute for pasta. I added my favorite pasta sauce and parmasan for a quick low carb gluten free mean. The e-book receipes are great. I just made the veggie quiche and it is delicious. Sprializer is small, light, easy to store and could even fit in your suitcase to travel. The customer service is exceptional and I will remain a fan of their company and products. Thanks, Pat
customer_reviews.author: Pat in MT

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for here people! It seems to be made of inexpensive materials but that doesn’t mean it doesn’t work great. My zucchini noodles turned out amazing. It really uses almost the entire vegetables, I had less than an inch worth of zucchini leftover that I couldn’t get through it. I don’t expect it to last forever, since it is made of cheap materials, but it’s totally worth it for the price. I’m glad I didn’t spend 3x the price for a fancy crank and 8 different blades. All I need is noodles. Linguine vs. spaghetti makes no difference to me when it’s just a veggie noodle.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica P.

customer_reviews.title: Yes, buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I do like the spiralizer and am still experimenting and adjusting. Laughed at my first experience which was with zuchinni. I turned and turned and had a lovely plate of spirals. I microwaved briefly and served with some olive oil, salt and pepper. My husband was served first an when he went to eat, his piece was about 3 feet long. The next time I cut the spirals so they was more manageable.
customer_reviews.author: nan linds

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and makes great size veggie noodles
customer_reviews.text: Tonight was my first time ever using a veggie spiralizer. It was super simple to use, pretty much if you can sharpen a pencil you can spiralize your veggies. I made zucchini noodles. I washed the zucchini and cut off the end with the stem. Twisted it through the SpiralLife and then sautéed them for about 10 minutes. We ate them as a our noodles with a cream sauce. To clean the spiralizer you do need to use a brush or the tool they provide for the bits stuck in it but I cleaned it in under a minute and now it’s ready to use for next time!
customer_reviews.author: Tkop

customer_reviews.title: Spiralled veggies - YUM!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has one of these, and after she made zucchini and onions sauteed in some olive oil - I knew I needed one for myself. Last night was spaghetti sauce over spiraled zucchini and it was so delicious and healthy! I like this style simply because it doesn't take up much space in my utensil drawer :-)
customer_reviews.author: D. Masselink

customer_reviews.title: Handy Little Gadget
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time this afternoon. I made a water beverage with spiraled cucumber, mint, watermelon, ice cubes and water. The spiralizer is easy to use, just like they said it would be. I popped the cucumber in and turned it like a giant pencil sharpener. It worked great. And it doesn't take up a lot of space in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for both home and travel
customer_reviews.text: This is the best little addition to my kitchen in years. Very easy to use and produces wonderfully fresh and tasty veggie noodles in seconds. It is so compact that it is now part of my regular camping supplies as well. Much easier to clean the blades using just a kitchen scrub brush if done immediately after use rather than allowing the noodles to dry on the blade. Definitely highly recommended for anyone wanting a quick, tasty, and simple way to eat more nutritiously!
customer_reviews.author: Sue S.

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! easy to use, minimal product waste, easy to clean and small. I have enough large appliances in my kitchen blender, crock pot, mandolin slicer, belgian waffle maker...ect, so I like that it does not require much space for storage or an outlet to use. I have only used yellow summer squash and zucchini in it thus far. I am a spaghetti addict but try not to carb overload as it slows my whole system down so I am excited to experiment with different recipes.
customer_reviews.author: k-slice

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Great product for zucchini noodles. I went on a diet and ate a ton of zucchini noodles during that time. I still enjoy them from time to time, but kind of burned myself out on them. The hardest part is starting the process. After you begin the zucchini comes out perfect. I would refridgerate the extra to use again the next day. Also, this make great addition to vegetable soup. I just cut it up with two or three chops and droop it into my soup.
customer_reviews.author: Jhow

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient!
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a contraption that was the size of a mandoline slicer when I made zucchini noodles, but I hated bringing it out and found myself rarely using it because it was a pain in the butt to clean and was way too big. I came across this product and it is so much easier to use! It fits in the palm of my hand and when I am done I just throw it into my dishwasher!
customer_reviews.author: daners82

customer_reviews.title: The spirals were super easy to make
customer_reviews.text: Would have given it 5 if the top made any sense. The spirals were super easy to make. They were relish. It doesn't take up any room which is great. Feels like a solid little tool. Hope to try out more than just squash soon. Great that it also comes with a peeler and brush! I don't understand the top at all. It comes apart. The little bumps do not hold in a squash end. But it didn't bother me to much. Not sure what the very top piece with the slit is for. Wish it would screw to the base so it stayed together in the drawer. Great addition to my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Kat McD Reseda

customer_reviews.title: Some veggies won’t fit but others will
customer_reviews.text: I So hopefully they publish my comment. This product Suuuuucks. It’s not versatile. I’m giving this product an overall 3 star review otherwise Amazon or whomever will not publish or will say that the review isn’t helpful. This product not easy to use. All veggies have to be a specific size in order to get a spiralized veg. I’m sorry but this “sponsored” product was a huge disappointment. And I want to order a different spirilizer now but I don’t trust any of the stars.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Damone

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: I am not very good in the kitchen (not kitchen savvy can burn a boiled egg!), to me it works great. Easy to use (I don't have to use a lot of force). Fisrt time doing zuchini noodles, excellent. have not ued the veggie peeler, but the spiralizer is good. I don't look for perfection in the size and shape of the noodles, to me they were just great
customer_reviews.author: YABUD

customer_reviews.title: Fun and useful
customer_reviews.text: I got this a couple of days ago and have used it only for zucchini (the reason I got it) and cucumbers, so far. I cook for either one or two people and for this number it works perfectly for zucchini. My cucumber was a little soft, so I didn't get quite the beautiful spirals as I did with the zucchini, but since I was going to use it to make the cucumber simple syrup in the eBook that came with the device, it didn't really matter. (The resulting cucumber mint giblet was excellent.) I also like the size and ease of storage and it is fun to watch the spirals form.
customer_reviews.author: Dolores Gitlin

customer_reviews.title: Great for the occasional zucchini zoodles
customer_reviews.text: I'll start by saying I had one of the larger, tabletop spiralizers but gave it away because it was so large and I didn't use it often. This smaller version is perfect for the occasional zucchini, but struggled to make longer spirals from carrots and harder options. If you dont plan to spiral veggies often and primarily plan to use zucchini or squash, this is an awesome tool that cleans well. Otherwise, invest a bit more for a bigger option.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: My zucchini slicer arrived today and I immediately used it to make my lunch. Zucchini spaghetti with ground turkey! Soooo good! I put a little olive oil and minced garlic and tossed the noodles for 5 minutes and put the sauce over it. Must have for every house hold! 👍👌🏻
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This does take some strength and with longer items like cucumber and zucchini, your arm will start to hurt. It is incredibly difficult to clean the center and in between the blades and fruit and vegetable seeds are prone to get stuck requiring some precision skills to remove. However, this is amazing to have any vegetable to the next level. Gluten free pasta using a zucchini, or cucumber ribbons, carrot pasta. There are no limits!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Sena

customer_reviews.title: Nice Healthy Choice
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to use and I love the recipes I can make with it. My husband isn't so excited about replacing pasta with veggies but I think they taste great! But he doesn't mind slicing them up for me so it's a good compromise. After 45 years of marriage that's what it's all about. The price is right and easy to use and it can go with you if need be. I use it in our RV so it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: carin carlton

customer_reviews.title: Easy, sharp, and great to use
customer_reviews.text: I've wound up buying many of these for other friends and family members as well. They are so easy to use and do an incredible job, leaving very little "waste." Truthfully, the only thing left over is the stem and the tiny tip that gets cut off, like you would the end of a cucumber. Zoodles need trimming afterwards because they come out so long, with no interruptions in the cutting process. Much better than others I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Lorna Finning

customer_reviews.title: A must for every kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: This little tool is one of my most used kitchen tools, since I started the Whole30 diet plan. Its durable and super sharp and makes meal prep a breeze. I use it often for my zucchini "noodles", but I've found lots of other uses for this little gem. It's the best kitchen purchase I've made in years,. Great price too!
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: I think I expected too much
customer_reviews.text: Used it once and gave it away. This is great for soft fruits such as zucchini and cuccumber but won't cut carrots, broccoli stalks, or cauliflower stalks. The manual turning also hurt my wrist. It is fine for one serving but not for the whole family. Once I got over having to have long strands, I realized that I can do everything on my mandoline which is sharper, faster, easier.
customer_reviews.author: Kalen Vavla

customer_reviews.title: Just what we were looking for. I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: We picked this one because it looked compact and simple - and both turned out to be true. It’s very small so it won’t take up much space to store and you seriously just put the zucchini (or whatever you’re processing) in and start turning it. The cap is handy for when you’re getting down to the end of the vegetable. Very easy to use and clean. We used it for the first time last night for a zucchini noodle recipe. We used 4 medium zucchini and it didn’t take long to process them and wow dinner was delicious. I might take this thing camping... Shipping was really quick too.
customer_reviews.author: jurissah naive

customer_reviews.title: The blade is sharp and there is very little waste
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little spiralizer. I only tried it with zucchini so far. I found it best to cut the zucchini in half so that it is not so long and there is more control in twisting. If you will be doing a lot of vegetables, or if you have weak wrists, you may not want a spiralizer that you twist manually. One with a crank would be better. But all I intend to use this for is making zoodles (zucchini noodles) for two people, so it's great.
customer_reviews.author: SonataSM

customer_reviews.title: Handy little device!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make zucchini noodles, and it works perfectly for that. We've been eating lo-carb around here for years and have been experimenting with serving noodle dishes without the noodles. Some are just fine without the carbs (Beef Stroganoff) but others (marinara) not so much. The spiralizer is just a pencil-sharpener type gizmo that works best with long, narrow veggies like the humble zucchini. The wrist action wasn't too strenuous for my 57-year-old wrists, though I don't know what it'd be like to do more than two in one sitting. Oodles of recipes online for a nice variety of ways to use the zoodles. Handy little device.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Works well and easy to store
customer_reviews.text: This spiralizer works really well. It's sharp and makes zoodles really quickly and with very little waste. It's also tiny and easy to store if you are pressed for space and it comes in a drawstring bag for storage. It also came with a small book of recipes which is a nice extra. My only issues is its not always so easy to clean if a piece happens to get stuck on the blade, but other than that...it's wonderful :)
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Great little gadget
customer_reviews.text: I made zoodles last night, sautéed in olive oil, salt, pepper and tossed with pesto and additional fresh basil. This was served under my Chicken Francese in lieu of pasta. Very delicious. I like this little tool. It’s compact and easy to use. I’m a very versatile, experienced cook. As such, my kitchen is over-stuffed with implements, cookware, etc. Nice that this little gizmo takes up almost no space.
customer_reviews.author: FIGARO

customer_reviews.title: Need strong hands and small veggies
customer_reviews.text: It is probably fine for someone with small vegetables and large hands. By the time I got through 2 small zucchinis my hands were aching. The third one was slightly larger and the diameter was too much for this tool. I can't even imagine doing a sweet potato as suggested in an email. Turns out, I don't like zucchini cooked or raw, so I am not likely to use the SpiraLife again. (I got a mandoline, instead.) Was going to return it, but the return shipping is about 7/12 of what I paid, so I'll give it away or sell at a garage sale.
customer_reviews.author: Library Lady

customer_reviews.title: Oooodles of zoodles
customer_reviews.text: I had an over abundance of zucchini this year from my family members garden. Having prepared it in every conceivable way we were all sick of it. I purchased this product to attempt to make some zoodle recipes I found online. This product worked like a dream, easy to use but not so easy to clean. But for the price I'm more than happy to spend an extra minute picking out zucchini bits from the cracks. It is dishwasher safe, so maybe next time I'll just chuck it in there....
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Bleeding out
customer_reviews.text: Sliced my finger open the second time I used it no guard. Absolute nonsense Updated review: Don't use the bag if you still buy it. I was taking it out of the bag which is the same height of the product. I had to grab the product and that's where my finger got sliced. Not using the product. Just taking it out of the bag. Three stitches.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Dieffenderfer

customer_reviews.title: Revised my review--best customer service ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I was disgruntled when my device broke and left an uncomplimentary review. Within just a few hours I was contacted with an offer for replacement because the company does not want anyone unhappy with the product. Who does that? Someone with outstanding customer service!! I sent my original order number and mailing address and I had my new device in about two days. It works great, and I am overwhelmed with the better than outstanding customer service!! What a pleasure!!
customer_reviews.author: Pygmyluvr

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for small quantities
customer_reviews.text: This little pencil sharpener style spiralizer is easy to use and gives you nice zoodles (sorry, I've only tried it on zucchini). My tips : hold the zucchini as in-line with the spiralizer as possible as you turn to get loooong zoodles. Cutting the stem off the zucchini helps the cap grip the veggie better and get the least/smallest stub of unspiralized veggie. .... BUT, unfortunately this takes too long to make enough zoodles for my family of 5! So I need to get a countertop crank type.
customer_reviews.author: plc

customer_reviews.title: I greatly wanted to like this product
customer_reviews.text: I greatly wanted to like this product. The first time, it worked great. By the second, the blades had dulled considerably. Instead of zoodles being a quick alternative to pasta, it took me probably about twenty minutes to run 4 small zucchini through this thing. It worked decently, except the zucchini kept getting stuck. I loved how small/compact this product was especially compared to the countertop spiralizers, but I'm highly disappointed at how inefficient this this was!
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: ALL U NEED
customer_reviews.text: SPIRALIZER if ur on a carb-restricted diet and miss spaghetti, this is PERFECT. debated between this or the big countertop slicer with all the attachments (id prob never use anyway). so glad i decided on this one -- small enough to fit into a drawer, easy to clean, turns a good sized zucchini into spaghetti-like strands in seconds, put it in a bowl, add sauce, its actually really good! def recommend (o:
customer_reviews.author: nb

customer_reviews.title: Easy Compact Spiralizer
customer_reviews.text: I love this spiralizer! Bought this to make zoodles. I was initially looking into a bigger gadget that took up some kitchen space which always made me hesitant to purchase one of these. When I came across this product.. I didn’t hesitate— the price was right, it’s small and compact and doesn’t take up much space in the kitchen. I used it immediately upon receiving. It’s very easy to use. I was able to use this with 3 zucchini’s while my ground turkey was cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price this tool is awesome. I was so excited to find a tool to help me spiralize my veggies aand help aid me in my new health kick. This did the trick and is easy to use and clean. My first dinner I made with this was the zucchini noodles and my famly loved the dinner. I started eating before I took the pic to do my review lol. If you look at this take the leap and purchase you wont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: S.A

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitchen Gadget
customer_reviews.text: There were lots of tools advertised that spiraled vegetables and I selected this one because it looked small and simple. It works quickly (even though it doesn't use batteries), and efficiently uses almost the whole zucchini. The tiny bit that's left I just diced. It's easy to clean using the little brush that comes with it and I especially appreciate that it doesn't take up a lot of space to store. This is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyCakes

customer_reviews.title: Great Meal Prep Option
customer_reviews.text: Rating 5/5 Great, simple spiralizer with two different blade options. Includes a tiny cleaning brush and the company will email you a ebook. I believe this spiralizer works best with smaller vegetables but I have managed medium sized sweet potatoes. I love to do up a bunch of veggies and freeze them for later or meal prep. This is a great entry spiralizer that is really affordable!
customer_reviews.author: BarLee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: We were going low carb and looking for pasta substitutes but having little success - and we tried it all! Finally decided to get something to make fresh zucchini noodles and bought this. Well, I should have started here!! Easy to use, pretty easy to clean, this handy gadget makes zucchini noodles a snap and the whole family loves them!
customer_reviews.author: 50 in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use -- no fuss
customer_reviews.text: I love this little gizmo. I wanted to be able to spiralize, but I didn't want a big To-Do of an apparatus. This takes up so little space, provides me with what I want, is easy to use, and cleans up easily. The small nubs that remain at the end are so cute. I either pop them in my mouth or use them as a little topping. This gadget might not be for you heavy duty spiralizers, but it works well for a low-key, mini spiralizer like me.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: It can be used for pretty much one purpose which is spiralizing vegetables but it does this task fairly well. I took off one star because the piece meant to stick into the end of the vegetable to avoid cutting your fingers is pretty useless because it just shreds up that end of the vegetable and you end up having to take it out and use it by hand anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zucchini mush vs noodles
customer_reviews.text: Here is a picture of the zucchini that I spiralized with this spiral life device the one on the right is from this device the one on the left is from my paderno spiralizer. this device makes mush... it was the same zucchini there’s no way it’s like a noodle horrible ! I bought this thinking it would be quick and easy....it was neither....a total dud
customer_reviews.author: Patricia S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, two sides, durable
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself a lot of money by getting one of these. Before this, I was purchasing zoodles at the grocery store and that costs a lot of money. Ended up getting one of these after having bought previous, poorly made ones in hopes of getting a decent one. This one met and exceeded my expectations on quality. Easy to grip, cut smoothly, I use it several times a week and it's held up month after month.
customer_reviews.author: Riderz644

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tool. It is small and compact. I generally only want to do 1-2 zucchinis at a time, so there is really no need for anything larger! It works exactly as expected. I even use this instead of shredding my zucchini when a recipe calls for it because it is just so much easier! Spiral and chop!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and does the job, only downfall it take a lot of elbow grease (if you understand what I mean). I wouldn’t recommend if your cooking for a large family or a large dish as this is a manual grinder and will take time if you have a lot to slice. Other than having to grind it up manual it’s a great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kim C

customer_reviews.title: Hand Written Thank You! You NEVER see that.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Small enough to store away, doesn't take up a bunch of space. Made perfect spirals. The biggest thing for me is it came from a small business and I love to support them when I can. They even sent a hand written thank you card for purchasing from them! Great customer service, money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Knutsen

customer_reviews.title: Great Veggie Spiralizer
customer_reviews.text: This works really well. It's good for making spiralized vegetables for one or two people. For larger groups of people I recommend getting the bigger sprializer machine. This one works well for me. It's small and easy to store. They include a handy little brush for helping to clean it. It's a great way of eating veggies. It works best if you use small to medium round veggies. It does not work well if the veggies are too large or not cylinder in shape.
customer_reviews.author: Das Englisch von Königin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical to order this even though I had watched a few videos of this and looked good. I received this last night and already tried it this morning. It is amazing!!!! I have another big spiralizer and this one sucked in so many ways. So i wanted to try a small one instead. This is truly the best buy!!! I have only tried with zucchini.
customer_reviews.author: Hitomi Tran

customer_reviews.title: Nice little kitchen gadget!
customer_reviews.text: I like my SpiraLife tool. It is easy to use, clean, and small which is important in my condo kitchen. I made zucchini noodles in place of spaghetti with red sauce one night and it was very tasty. My husband is gluten intolerant so it was nice to be able to enjoy and old favorite - plus healthier. The e-cookbook has good recipes and the owners periodically send new recipes via e-mail that remind me to use the tool now and then. For example, I plan on making soup today, got an e-mail and thought, 'Hey! I can use my SpiraLife to prep some of the vegis that I'm including in the soup."
customer_reviews.author: Billie

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are trying to cut down on carbs, so I thought I'd give this gadget a whirl. It makes really easy action out of getting zucchini into those long, thin "noodles." I then tossed it with some really good olive oil (I use Sanders First Fresh. EXCELLENT!!! Look online), S/P, lemon juice, basil, and parm cheese. This made a terrific, extremely low calorie dish. While it cannot turn that zucchini diddy into fettuccine Alfredo, it's your ingredients, not your gadget. This thing works very well, is reasonably priced, and I enjoy the E-recipies that came along with it.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline K. Reece

customer_reviews.title: Good Spiralizer
customer_reviews.text: This spiralizer works really well. I have used it for zucchini and summer squash. I have found that peeling the vegetables first makes for better "noodles". I tried mini cucumbers with this and it did not work. The cucumber (or any vegetable) has to be thick/big in order for it to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Crazy Easy! Wish I had this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: This is a kitchen must have. We live in a small NYC apartment - so space is a real issue. This tucks away easily in a drawer, on a shelf or in a cabinet. It is quick & easy to use. It has already become a staple in our kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: CMCP

customer_reviews.title: Alters zucchini so much it's not recognizable by sight or taste
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like this product, at all. It was awkward mounting a zucchini to it, and the "spiral" is more like a thin layer of zucchini that cooks flat and ends up being awkward to eat as well. Zucchini is probably my favorite, versatile vegetable, and using this, you can't even recognize it by sight or taste. Prefer chunks of zucchini to this.
customer_reviews.author: CYCOLOGISTTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: slicer is eady to hold
customer_reviews.text: this was my second attempt purchasing a hand spiralizer. i should have purchased this one first. its easy to use,easy to hold,has the option of 2 blades,top holds veggie firmly when to small to use hands to twist. make sureto use brush to remove all particles in blade when cleaning. i love the storage bag,keeps everything in 1 place.
customer_reviews.author: ikie

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Sharp Blades, Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I love this little kitchen tool! It's small so it doesn't take up much space. It's lightweight and easy to use. The sharp blades cut extremely well allowing you to get perfect veggie noodles. The only complaint I have, is the diameter is not adjustable, so larger vegetables will not work with this spiralizer. I had bought some squash that was a little large on one end and would not fit so I had to cut them down some. Other than that, I would recommend it for those looking for an inexpensive spiralizer.
customer_reviews.author: Devara G.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: This product works pretty well considering it's price. It worked as intended, and helped me incorporate some extra veggies into my diet! The vegetable shaver it comes with is pretty cheap though, and I would not rely on it at all. Pros Good price Spirals vegetables well Good size Cons A little annoying to clean sometimes Lid/top doesn't help me at all Vegetable shaver is really cheap At a price like this, it's kind of hard to complain too much. It works, and that's all that really matters to me.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.text: Made zucchini noodles with spaghetti sauce for two nights this week and it was amazing. Great for people on a low carb diet or anyone who wants to trick their kids into eating some more vegetables. Won't be going back to real spaghetti anytime soon. The only problem I would say is that it doesn't work for large zucchinis. For the recipe I just use an onion, garlic, a can of tomato sauce, italian seasoning, and some milk (to reduce acidity), and bring it to a boil then simmer. Then I throw about 2-3 zucchini (noodles), cover the pot and simmer for about 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add salt and pepper and/or parmesan cheese.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Low-quality device
customer_reviews.text: The device arrived with scratches on it already. It is made of plastic and gives off an impression of junkiness. I was only able to spiralize PART of a zucchini, and the rest did not fit and was wasted. I'm quite disappointed. It's Ok if you're on vacation somewhere, I guess, but I'll be throwing it out and ordering a better quality spiralizer!!!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Feinerman

customer_reviews.title: Small so goes anywhere!
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It’s small and you can easily take it with you and use outside of your kitchen.....like work, when visiting, camping and so on. Best $10, I’ve spent in a while! Made yellow squash and zucchini spaghetti noodles. Boiled 4 mins......perfect... The tiny leftovers from the spirals got chopped up and added to cooked turkey bacon pieces, sautéed them all with garlic, olive oil and baby Bella mushrooms then topped it all with some Parmesan cheese. Heavenly.......
customer_reviews.author: responder

customer_reviews.title: Well it does - I absolutely love the zucchini spaghetti maker
customer_reviews.text: Oh My Gosh - who would have thought that the shape of a zucchini would make such a difference. Well it does - I absolutely love the zucchini spaghetti maker! Easy to use; easy to store (I have a very small kitchen - fits in the silverware drawer); easy to clean (comes with a little spiral brush. . And your dinner becomes fun to eat when zucchini is shaped like spaghetti!
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Very useful for my lifestyle
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Zucchini noodles for me every time I make my family regular noodles to keep my carbs down low! I even use it to spiralize cucumber on my salads. You do have to use your hand/arm manually to use it but I rather do that then spend a bunch of money on a motorized one. Doesn’t bother me!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, does a perfect job. Of course your arm almost falls off but eventually you kind of develop a method. I'm completely happy with it. Don't see any reason it wouldn't last a long time, there isn't much to it to break. Oh, except forget about the peeler, it fell apart in my hand, as in broke not just came apart but I couldn't care less, I have a good peeler doesn't everyone?
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Tiring & cheap, not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: It works, but it’s not the easiest. You end up waisting the ends. The top poky part does not hold onto the sweet potatoes or the zucchini I tried to “zoodle”. I ended up having to use my fingers, digging my nails into the veggie to get it to turn. Plus, very tiring! Arms soar from constantly twisting veggies to get enough zoodles. Just by the frozen zucchini zoodles from Costco.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Jonkman

customer_reviews.title: I love my SpiraLife Spiralizer
customer_reviews.text: I love my SpiraLife Spiralizer! I was surprised when I received it because it was much smaller than I thought it would be. I was skeptical as to how it would work but to my surprise it works amazingly great! I have used it almost every single day since I received it. So far I have only used it to spiralize zucchini but can't wait to try it on other veggies. Its easy to clean and doesn't take up much room in my kitchen! I can definitely highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Suzie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use, and makes perfect zoodles! The cap on the end makes it possible to get the most out of the zucchini, leaving very little waste. I have not tried it with other veggies (only zucchini so far) but I am quite pleased with this little gadget! And it doesn't take up much room like other spiralizers do. Just wash, dry, and store it in a drawer for easy access and daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Brunning

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Compact, Fantastic Spiralizer!
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted to try one of these. I love veggies and am trying to adapt to a healthier lifestyle, rather than dieting. This little handheld spiralizer is AWESOME! Worked great right out of the gate with no learning curve. I used squash and zucchini instead of noodles with salmon, tomatoes, spinach, and lemon zest. It was delicious! Plus, it was super easy to clean and stores in a cute, little bag. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item because my daughter loves zucchini noodles. But, I found out that this was extremely hard to use and made my hand sore. The noodles kept breaking and it was a messy clean up. I don’t recommend this product, would have returned if we tested out this product sooner.
customer_reviews.author: yammy au

customer_reviews.title: Video review: Life-changing kitchen gadget for the paleo or gluten free household
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is outstanding. As you can see in my video, I whip up a bowl of pasta... oh wait, no! It's zucchini. And the taste? The exact same. This little guy cuts and slices and spirals twirls veggies into more edible meals.
customer_reviews.author: Beau Chevassus

customer_reviews.title: I'm A Fan!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a big fan of trendy kitchen gadgets but I am delighted with the SpiraLife. I recently went on Weight Watchers and have been eating a primarily vegetarian menu. Lots of salads and lots of organic veggies. I love the different textures you can get with this tool and how much volume it adds to the portions of veggies. I've made "pasta" several times with zucchini and summer squash and it really feels like I'm eating pasta. My favorite way to use this is to spiral some squash and carrots; quickly saute them and toss with tons of fresh herbs like mint, basil, lemon balm and add a sprinkle of fat free feta cheese. So good!
customer_reviews.author: KrisVT

customer_reviews.title: Completely changed the way i eat!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best thing I've purchased in a long long time. I was surprised when I got it in the mail because I thought it was going to be larger and difficult to fit in a kitchen drawer. Nope! This has allowed me to eliminate almost all pasta out of my diet spirilizer carrots and zucchini. I've also used the ribbon side to make a "stove top lasagna" If I was going to offer anyone any advice, I would recommend that the "handle" doesn't really work well so leave the stem on your zucchini or squash and use that as your handle. You'll avoid cutting your fingers and have no waste!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Chick

customer_reviews.title: Seems great, haven't used yet - UPDATED
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived and I'm excited to use it. My biggest issue is that the accessory that comes with it (I believe the peeler) came broken. It was in a box, inside of another box, so I'm not certain how this could happen unless there's faulty production. Update 3/22/19 I have used the product now; it was extremely easy to use and worked perfectly. Time will tell if the blades hold up. I also contacted the seller about the defective item I received. It seems they've had a lot of issues with the peeler and had a recall. They credited me for the damaged/broken item. No complaints over here!
customer_reviews.author: akaploe

customer_reviews.title: zoodler doesn't work well
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the zoodler to make zucchini noodles, however, it doesn't fit normal size zucchini. It fits small ones. It is hard to actual make noodles and doesn't wash well.
customer_reviews.author: TO

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little gadget. I've made butternut squash chips with the thick end of it. (I wanted to post a photo, but they were too yummy and they disappeared too fast.) I also have made zucchini "spaghetti" twice and it's delicious and so easy. Very happy that I purchased this item. I bought one for our house and one for our vacation condo. I also like that the seller provided a free e-book with recipes and tips and then sent a few more emails with more tips and recipes. I feel like they really wanted to help me get the most benefit possible from purchasing their product.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Worth

customer_reviews.title: Great tool with bonus veggie peeler
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and clean. Encourages us to eat more veggies. Dishes look beautiful with the zucchini noodles. I absolutely loved the bonus veggie peeler. It is awesome. Peels even the most difficult sweet potatoes. Excellent kitchen tool at a great price. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but you must take care not to include ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this spiralizer once since I bought it. Works great, but you must take care not to include your finger in the spiralizing process. It makes lovely spiral shavings of squash that I used under my meats which allows them to steam and soften. I haven't received my e-book recipes yet, but hope they will be delicious additions to my repertoire.
customer_reviews.author: E. Denny

customer_reviews.title: Super durable, but takes some elbow grease
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t honestly expecting much from this little thing, but it works WAY better than the big spiralizer that my boyfriend has taking up a bunch of space in his kitchen. We can even crank out sweet potato noodles with it (which would easily break his spiralizer!)—sweet potatoes take a LOT of strength to crank out, so the fact that this little spiralizer has done it multiple times with no sign of wear, I’d say it’s a well-made piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I received great customer service from SpriraLife. Although, I had intended to use this for carrots, which I wasn't super successful at, I can see how other veggies like zucchini or cucumber would work beautifully. I appreciated the little cleaning brush that comes with it. Without the brush, it would be difficult to get all the veggie bits out of the blades without spiralizing your fingernails.
customer_reviews.author: Mdens

customer_reviews.title: Well designed, compact little Spiralizer
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving it as a gift so I won't actually be using it, but I opened it up and played around with it. It's a very clever and simple design, which I think it just perfect. It's nice and compact, and there aren't really any moving parts to break. It also comes with a peeler and a little brush for washing, all together in a nice little pouch, in an impeccable box. Again, I haven't used it, but the design is great, I can't really see it breaking ever, and comes packaged up really nicely! And it's a great price too! Go ahead and get it!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Allison

customer_reviews.title: its pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to atart eating zucchini noodles instead of pasta to eat healthier and eat less carbs. So far I am happy with the purchase because I been making alot of zucchini noodles and it so delicious. I really could replace pasta with zucchini noodles instead, for a long time. The only down fall is that the top part sometimes doesn't work because either the zucchini is too soft to make it turn not sure what i am doing wrong. But so far happy with it. Happy to eat my veggies. It helped alot with my constipation.
customer_reviews.author: Rizza

customer_reviews.title: We love our SpiralLife spiralizer and vegetable peeler
customer_reviews.text: We love our SpiralLife spiralizer and vegetable peeler. Lifestyle Dynamics is a wonderful company too!! I ended up having a small problem with the extra vegetable peeler that was included. First of all they were so nice about helping me when I contacted them about it, and second, they went above and beyond to make it right!! I would defiantly order from them again and tell others as well about this product bc of the level of service you get if you aren't satisfied. That says a lot about a company in itself! Looking forward to spiralizing so many different veggies!!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Cool Gadget
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool kitchen gadget and works exactly as described. Definitely worth the few dollars to be able to add more veggies to our typical meals, and to add a more refined look to the presentation of some of our cooking. Easy to use, easy to clean (I just put mine in the dishwasher) and durable enough to be used over and over. not to mention it is not big so it easily fits into my small kitchen. I would definitely recommend​ this product for people who want to eat veggies/fruits in new and exciting ways, and for people who want to add a new kitchen skill to their arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: Kfulls

product_meta.title: Original SpiraLife Spiralizer Vegetable Slicer – Vegetable Spiralizer - Spiral Slicer Cutter
feature_bullets: ★ WHILE OTHER HANDHELD SPIRALIZERS TRY TO TEMPT YOU with bundle offers, THEY WON’T ADMIT TO THE WASTEFULNESS of their zucchini spaghetti maker design. Just TAKE A LOOK AT OUR SECOND IMAGE to see what we mean. Our SHORTER, WIDER FUNNEL and SPECIALLY DESIGNED CAP ensure that much more of your veggie is turned into zoodles. Just the way it should be! A BETTER DESIGN from us means LESS WASTE for you! AS SEEN ON THE TODAY SHOW, HUFFPOST AND MASHABLE!

★ THICKER BLADE OPENING MEANS NO SHREDDED ZUCCHINI with both our veggie noodle and ribbon blade. NO CLOGGING OR JAMMING. No more shredding your veggies to mush. Our EXTRA SHARP BLADES make precision cuts for STURDY ZOODLES that can stand up even in thick sauces and soups! EASY TO CLEAN & DISHWASHER SAFE.

★ OUR HOW-TO VIDEOS PROVIDE THE INSTRUCTION THAT OTHERS DON’T. As with any new kitchen gadget, you want to LEARN HOW TO USE IT CORRECTLY so that you aren’t frustrated or disappointed. From HOW TO EASILY CLEAN your zucchini noodle maker to USAGE TIPS AND SUGGESTIONS, our 5 VIDEO SERIES help you and your loved ones to get the most out of your veggie slicer.

★ EXTRAS LIKE OUR VEGETABLE PEELER, CLEANING BRUSH, STORAGE BAG & VEGETABLE SPIRALIZER RECIPES EBOOK make our handheld vegetable spiralizer kit complete so that you have everything you need to start your zucchini spiral noodle maker journey. DELICIOUS SPIRALIZER SLICER RECIPES will have you loving your new vegetable spiral spiralizer.

★ OUR CUSTOMERS ARE MORE IMPORTANT THAN OUR SALES. If you are not absolutely happy with your hand held spiralizer, CONTACT US DIRECTLY and we will take care of you. WE LOVE TO HELP. Spiralife zoodler spiralizer makes a great Christmas gift for mom, chef gifts, or holiday gifts for foodies.
